intro: Impatiens hochstetteri subsp. hochstetteri, commonly known as the Hochstetter's impatiens, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to white. The plant typically grows as an annual or short-lived perennial, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its foliage consists of broad, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forest understories.
